oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: !nanni (XI)
Tamme (XII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An account of how women 'work', or cut themselves. Men cut (or bleed) themselves between the eyes with a knife. The blood is caught in a cup made of animal horn, held by another person. 1) p.9794v: see Intelligent and foolish people, 2) (7 April) see Respecting and eating the |no, 3) Da bears a cut between his eyes (see p.9448v), 4) This story is found in Book XI & XII-10.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd !kun notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bloodletting
